concept.title: What are macros?
concept.shortdesc: A brief description of the purpose of macros.

conbody.p: A task you have to perform regularly in Microsoft Excel can be automated with a macro. A macro is a series of commands and functions that can be executed by a single command or click. A series of commands can be put in a macro. By running the macro, those commands and actions are carried out in succession.

Excel macros are written in the language Visual Basic for Applications (VBA). The commands and actions of the macro are stored in a Visual Basic module. With the Visual Basic editor, you can edit macros, copy macros from one module to another, copy macros between different workbooks and rename the modules and macros.

The simple macros can be made by recording the actions with the built-in macro recorder. After starting the recorder all actions are recorded and converted to VBA code until the recorder is stopped. To get a good macro, it is therefore important to first note the actions to be carried out. To record, edit, and run macros, the Developer tab must be made visible.
